name: openWindowParams
doc:
@platform android 2.0.0 @platform iphone 2.0.0 @platform ipad 2.0.0 @pseudo @editurl https://github.com/appcelerator/titanium_mobile/edit/master/apidoc/Titanium/UI/Window.yml

Dictionary of options for the Titanium.UI.Window.open method.

property.name: activityEnterAnimation
property.doc:
Animation resource to run on the activity (heavyweight window) being opened.

@description

This value will be ignored if animated is set to false. See "Heavyweight Window Transitions in Android" in the main description of Titanium.UI.Window for more information.

Examples

Sliding in a new Window

var win2 = Ti.UI.createWindow({fullscreen:false});
win2.open({
    activityEnterAnimation: Ti.Android.R.anim.slide_in_left,
    activityExitAnimation: Ti.Android.R.anim.slide_out_right
});

@platform android 3.1.0
property.shortDoc: Animation resource to run on the activity (heavyweight window) being opened. ...

property.name: activityExitAnimation
property.doc:
Animation resource to run on the activity that is being put in background as a heavyweight window is being opened above it.

@description

This value will be ignored if animated is set to false. See "Heavyweight Window Transitions in Android" in the main description of Titanium.UI.Window for more information.

@platform android 3.1.0
property.shortDoc: Animation resource to run on the activity that is being put in background as a heavyweight window is being opened abo...

property.name: animated
property.doc:
Determines whether to use an animated effect when the window is shown.

@description

On Android, this property supports animated transitions on heavyweight windows except for modal windows (modal:true). See "Android Heavyweight and Lightweight Windows" in the main description of Titanium.UI.Window for more information. The transitions are on by default, but you can disable this behavior by setting this value to false.

On iOS, only use this property to disable animated transitions on modal windows. This property has unintended side effects on non-modal windows if it is defined.
property.shortDoc: Determines whether to use an animated effect when the window is shown. ...

property.name: bottom
property.doc:
Window's bottom position, in platform-specific units.

@description

On Android, this property only works with lightweight windows. See "Android Heavyweight and Lightweight Windows" in the main description of Titanium.UI.Window for more information.
property.shortDoc: Window's bottom position, in platform-specific units. ...

property.name: height
property.doc:
Window's height, in platform-specific units.

@description

On Android, before Titanium 3.2.0, this property only works with lightweight windows. See "Android Heavyweight and Lightweight Windows" in the main description of Titanium.UI.Window for more information.

property.name: left
property.doc:
Window's left position, in platform-specific units.

@description

On Android, this property only works with lightweight windows. See "Android Heavyweight and Lightweight Windows" in the main description of Titanium.UI.Window for more information.
property.shortDoc: Window's left position, in platform-specific units. ...

property.name: modal
property.doc: Determines whether to open the window modal in front of other windows.

property.name: modalStyle
property.doc:
Presentation style of this modal window.

This API can be assigned the following constants:

  • Titanium.UI.iPhone.MODAL_PRESENTATION_CURRENT_CONTEXT
  • Titanium.UI.iPhone.MODAL_PRESENTATION_FORMSHEET
  • Titanium.UI.iPhone.MODAL_PRESENTATION_FULLSCREEN
  • Titanium.UI.iPhone.MODAL_PRESENTATION_PAGESHEET

@platform iphone 2.0.0 @platform ipad 2.0.0
property.shortDoc: Presentation style of this modal window. ...

property.name: modalTransitionStyle
property.doc:
Transition style of this modal window.

This API can be assigned the following constants:

  • Titanium.UI.iPhone.MODAL_TRANSITION_STYLE_COVER_VERTICAL
  • Titanium.UI.iPhone.MODAL_TRANSITION_STYLE_CROSS_DISSOLVE
  • Titanium.UI.iPhone.MODAL_TRANSITION_STYLE_FLIP_HORIZONTAL
  • Titanium.UI.iPhone.MODAL_TRANSITION_STYLE_PARTIAL_CURL

@platform iphone 2.0.0 @platform ipad 2.0.0
property.shortDoc: Transition style of this modal window. ...

property.name: navBarHidden
property.doc:
For modal windows, hides the nav bar (true) or shows the nav bar (false).

@description

On iOS, beginning with Release 3.1.3, this is no longer a valid parameter passed to the Window.open method.
property.shortDoc: For modal windows, hides the nav bar (true) or shows the nav bar (false). ...

property.name: right
property.doc:
Window's right position, in platform-specific units.

@description

On Android, this property only works with lightweight windows. See "Android Heavyweight and Lightweight Windows" in the main description of Titanium.UI.Window for more information.
property.shortDoc: Window's right position, in platform-specific units. ...

property.name: top
property.doc:
Window's top position, in platform-specific units.

@description

On Android, this property only works with lightweight windows. See "Android Heavyweight and Lightweight Windows" in the main description of Titanium.UI.Window for more information.
property.shortDoc: Window's top position, in platform-specific units. ...

property.name: transition
property.doc:
Transition style of this non-modal window.

This API can be assigned the following constants:

  • Titanium.UI.iPhone.AnimationStyle.CURL_DOWN
  • Titanium.UI.iPhone.AnimationStyle.CURL_UP
  • Titanium.UI.iPhone.AnimationStyle.FLIP_FROM_LEFT
  • Titanium.UI.iPhone.AnimationStyle.FLIP_FROM_RIGHT
  • Titanium.UI.iPhone.AnimationStyle.NONE

@platform iphone 2.0.0 @platform ipad 2.0.0
property.shortDoc: Transition style of this non-modal window. ...

property.name: width
property.doc:
Window's width, in platform-specific units.

@description

On Android, before Titanium 3.2.0, this property only works with lightweight windows. See "Android Heavyweight and Lightweight Windows" in the main description of Titanium.UI.Window for more information.
